Notes: Camping World Stadium expansion to 80k+ seats (meets IOC requirement). Many existing venues (Amway Center, UCF facilities), largest hotel inventory, MCO international hub (50M+ capacity). FDOT investment: $4.1B corridor allocation.
Strong tourism and hotel base, Raymond James (65k), Amalie Arena (19k), TPA international (25M+ capacity). Brightline connection to Orlando. FDOT aviation + transit investment.
Central location on I-4 midpoint. Ideal for Olympic Village (3-4k units) with Brightline station adjacent. Post-Games conversion to workforce housing. Limited hotels/venues but strong logistics role.
Ben Hill Griffin Stadium (~88k capacity) but TOO FAR from core corridor (130 mi from Tampa, 120 mi from Orlando). Limited hotel/transit. EXCLUDED from joint bid due to distance.
Large international gateway (MIA), many hotels and restaurants; main stadiums <80k. Could host multiple events but distributed approach still needed.
Large area with stadiums ~67k, JAX international airport, but less hotel density than Orlando/Miami.
